<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/2020s-biggest-ipos-getting-smacked-markets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Comes After the Pop?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/2020s-biggest-ipos-getting-smacked-markets" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Snowflake IPO" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDE2L3Nub3dmbGFrZV9pcG8uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The fizzle. Some of the biggest companies to IPO in 2020 and early 2021 are finding the public markets to be less inviting than a middle school boy’s treehouse.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Renaissance IPO ETF, which holds a number of public companies that IPOed within the last two years, has fallen nearly 30% from its peak in February. Let's check in on a few of the companies:  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Airbnb: </strong></span><span>It may be the most valuable hospitality company in the world, but its stock has dropped more than 37% from its high and now sits below its opening price. Yesterday, CEO Brian Chesky predicted the “travel rebound of the century” this summer.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">DoorDash: </strong></span><span>The delivery company’s stock was down 47% from its peak, but it popped more than 7% after hours following a strong earnings report yesterday. Revenue </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/door-dash-first-quarter-earnings-2021-180531640.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped 219%</a></span><span> annually last quarter.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Coinbase: </strong></span><span>In its first earnings report as a public company, the huge crypto exchange </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/coinbase-q1-earnings-2021-185509331.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">missed expectations</a></span><span> and continues to trade well below its opening price. It said it would add more cryptocurrencies to its platform, including dogecoin in six to eight weeks.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Snowflake: </strong></span><span>The cloud data firm backed by Berkshire Hathaway made a splash last fall as the largest software IPO ever, but it's fallen more than 51% from its high. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bumble: </strong></span><span>Shares in the dating company </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/13/bumble-stock-falls-after-first-quarter-report-dipping-below-ipo-price.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dipped below</a></span><span> their initial price of $43 yesterday after reporting a mixed bag of earnings this week. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Given the wide range of industries these companies serve, it's hard to pinpoint one specific reason for their struggles. They're more like runaway buoys drifting in the choppy waters of the market, where investors have been piling out of tech stocks over fears of inflation and tighter monetary policy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the drooping share prices of freshly public companies is enough to spook some private firms from taking the IPO plunge. Hearing care services provider Hear.com and mortgage insurer Enact Holdings recently <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/hear-com-postpones-ipo-because-of-choppy-stock-market-11620920379?mod=hp_lista_pos5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delayed their IPOs</a> because of market volatility. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>It could take a lot more market mayhem to stop this IPO train, though. Last year, companies raised a record $167 billion in public listings, and they've already raised $158 billion so far this year. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/cdc-says-fully-vaccinated-people-can-ditch-masks-settings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Say Goodbye to Maskne
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/cdc-says-fully-vaccinated-people-can-ditch-masks-settings" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Face mask with beaded chains " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTg1L21hc2tfY2hhaW5zLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Say goodbye to maskne, or mask acne for those who have had perfect skin for the past year. The CDC <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/13/cdc-says-fully-vaccinated-people-dont-need-to-wear-face-masks-indoors-or-outdoors-in-most-settings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> yesterday that fully vaccinated people (meaning two weeks post-final shot) don't need to wear face masks in most indoor and outdoor settings. Dr. Anthony Fauci also doubled down on the CDC's April statement, telling CBS yesterday morning that "if you are vaccinated and you are outside, put aside your mask, you don’t have to wear it." You heard the man, show us your face.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Health-care settings, buses/trains, and airplanes are all spaces you'll still have to mask up regardless of vaccine status, but the announcement is sure to push the US even further toward a full-scale reopening.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>29 states have already fully reopened all nonessential businesses, and 22 states (and growing) don't have mask mandates.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than 1.7 million people traveled via US airports last Sunday, the most daily passengers since the pandemic started.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Just in time for a summer of long weekends.</strong> As of Thursday, 59% of US adults have received at least one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine, inching closer to Biden's new goal of 70% by the Fourth of July so they can all come to his barbecue.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/jpmorgan-wells-fargo-offer-credit-cards-consumers-without-credit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Give Wall Street Some Credit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/jpmorgan-wells-fargo-offer-credit-cards-consumers-without-credit" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Credit card with a broken lock to suggest consumer confidence rose " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTEzL2NoYWluZWRfdXBfY3JlZGl0X2NhcmQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Later this year, JPMorgan Chase, US Bancorp, and Wells Fargo will join several other banks in a pilot program offering credit cards to people without credit scores, the WSJ <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-others-plan-to-issue-credit-cards-to-people-with-no-credit-scores-11620898206?mod=hp_lead_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How's that gonna work?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Under the government-backed initiative, the companies will share information with each other about credit card applicants' bank accounts. They'll examine balances and overdraft histories to identify financially responsible individuals who weren't able to build credit before. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Eventually, the banks may make other financial products, like auto loans or mortgages, available to approved customers as well. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While banks and credit reporting firms <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90318224/now-wanted-by-equifax-and-other-credit-bureaus-your-alternative-data?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have tried</a> setting up alternative risk models before, they haven't found an industry-wide solution. Last summer's protests around racial injustice provided an extra push, and last year, banking, fintech, and nonprofit leaders met with the Treasury Department to find ways to get more credit into historically disadvantaged communities.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> For decades, a credit score was the golden ticket to a credit card. While there's no shortage of finance startups <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/teen-banking-apps-secure-funding?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hawking</a> credit-building apps to consumers as young as 13, a massive banking gap persists among adults: The creators of the FICO score estimate that 53 million US adults lack traditional credit scores. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/key-performance-indicators-may-14?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/key-performance-indicators-may-14" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="WNBA scene" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDcwL3duYmFfc2NlbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Julio Aguilar/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The WNBA tips off its 25th anniversary season tonight, and less than half of the 12 teams currently share ownership with an NBA squad, <a href="https://www.axios.com/wnba-owners-atlanta-dream-1a109779-06c1-474b-9714-b330f0ed1ba0.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Axios</a>. When the league started, all eight teams were located in cities with NBA teams and were required to share ownership. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"I think she appreciated it. It might not be the most traditionally romantic thing to do, but I figure that I'm helping her make a great investment."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">South Korean college student Jung Seung-Hyun <a href="https://www.insider.com/young-korean-couples-are-gifting-tesla-stocks-not-flowers-2021-5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a> to Insider why he bought stocks for his girlfriend on her birthday instead of flowers. It's a big trend in the country for couples to gift each other "stock gift cards" in companies like Tesla, Apple, Amazon, and Disney. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Rest of World is an awesome website reporting on global tech stories, and they're celebrating their first anniversary this week. Check out their pieces on <a href="https://restofworld.org/2021/stranger-than-family/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Korean adoptees being brought together by Facebook</a> or <a href="https://restofworld.org/2021/fact-checking-modis-india/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fact-checking Modi's India</a>. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMBLING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/us-gambling-revenue-booms-q1-matching-records?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
There's No Chip Shortage in Vegas
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/us-gambling-revenue-booms-q1-matching-records" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vegas sign" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjIxL2xhc192ZWdhcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>PublicDomainPictures</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US commercial casinos raked in $11.1 billion last quarter, according to the American Gaming Association, matching their <a href="https://apnews.com/article/sports-health-coronavirus-pandemic-business-bdf3597fde50ffafbb49965a3566757b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best quarter ever</a>. And 12 states set monthly gambling revenue records in March.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened? </strong>If the phrase of the year in 2020 was "in these unprecedented times," 2021 has brought us "pent-up demand." Flush with savings and itching for more excitement than a chessboard can provide, Americans have flocked to casinos to let loose.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And both traditional and new-ish sectors of the US gambling industry are seeing the benefits. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Las Vegas is back, if you trust all the </span><span><a href="https://www.ktnv.com/positivelylv/las-vegas-is-tourism-is-exploding-with-more-and-more-people-flying-to-and-from-the-city?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lines out the door</a></span><span> at McCarran International Airport. Southwest Airlines reported a significant rebound in traffic to Vegas after passenger demand plunged 97% during the pandemic.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sports gambling brought in $961 million last quarter, eclipsing the total revenue in 2019.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>States home to more than three-quarters of commercial casinos had rules capping occupancy at 50% in Q1, so revenue could boom even more this summer as capacity restrictions ease. On Wednesday, MGM's nine casino floors in Las Vegas got the green light to expand to 100% capacity. </p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe fizzle. Some of the biggest companies to IPO in 2020 and early 2021 are finding the public markets to be less inviting than a middle school boy’s treehouse.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Renaissance IPO ETF, which holds a number of public companies that IPOed within the last two years, has fallen nearly 30% from its peak in February. Let's check in on a few of the companies:  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAirbnb: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt may be the most valuable hospitality company in the world, but its stock has dropped more than 37% from its high and now sits below its opening price. Yesterday, CEO Brian Chesky predicted the “travel rebound of the century” this summer.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDoorDash: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe delivery company’s stock was down 47% from its peak, but it popped more than 7% after hours following a strong earnings report yesterday. Revenue \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/door-dash-first-quarter-earnings-2021-180531640.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped 219%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e annually last quarter.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCoinbase: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn its first earnings report as a public company, the huge crypto exchange \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/coinbase-q1-earnings-2021-185509331.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emissed expectations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and continues to trade well below its opening price. It said it would add more cryptocurrencies to its platform, including dogecoin in six to eight weeks.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSnowflake: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe cloud data firm backed by Berkshire Hathaway made a splash last fall as the largest software IPO ever, but it's fallen more than 51% from its high. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBumble: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShares in the dating company \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/13/bumble-stock-falls-after-first-quarter-report-dipping-below-ipo-price.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edipped below\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e their initial price of $43 yesterday after reporting a mixed bag of earnings this week. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe big picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGiven the wide range of industries these companies serve, it's hard to pinpoint one specific reason for their struggles. They're more like runaway buoys drifting in the choppy waters of the market, where investors have been piling out of tech stocks over fears of inflation and tighter monetary policy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the drooping share prices of freshly public companies is enough to spook some private firms from taking the IPO plunge. Hearing care services provider Hear.com and mortgage insurer Enact Holdings recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/hear-com-postpones-ipo-because-of-choppy-stock-market-11620920379?mod=hp_lista_pos5\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edelayed their IPOs\u003c/a\u003e because of market volatility. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIt could take a lot more market mayhem to stop this IPO train, though. Last year, companies raised a record $167 billion in public listings, and they've already raised $158 billion so far this year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSay goodbye to maskne, or mask acne for those who have had perfect skin for the past year. The CDC \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/13/cdc-says-fully-vaccinated-people-dont-need-to-wear-face-masks-indoors-or-outdoors-in-most-settings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that fully vaccinated people (meaning two weeks post-final shot) don't need to wear face masks in most indoor and outdoor settings. Dr. Anthony Fauci also doubled down on the CDC's April statement, telling CBS yesterday morning that \"if you are vaccinated and you are outside, put aside your mask, you don’t have to wear it.\" You heard the man, show us your face.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHealth-care settings, buses/trains, and airplanes are all spaces you'll still have to mask up regardless of vaccine status, but the announcement is sure to push the US even further toward a full-scale reopening.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e29 states have already fully reopened all nonessential businesses, and 22 states (and growing) don't have mask mandates.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore than 1.7 million people traveled via US airports last Sunday, the most daily passengers since the pandemic started.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJust in time for a summer of long weekends.\u003c/strong\u003e As of Thursday, 59% of US adults have received at least one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine, inching closer to Biden's new goal of 70% by the Fourth of July so they can all come to his barbecue.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLater this year, JPMorgan Chase, US Bancorp, and Wells Fargo will join several other banks in a pilot program offering credit cards to people without credit scores, the WSJ \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-others-plan-to-issue-credit-cards-to-people-with-no-credit-scores-11620898206?mod=hp_lead_pos3\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow's that gonna work?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnder the government-backed initiative, the companies will share information with each other about credit card applicants' bank accounts. They'll examine balances and overdraft histories to identify financially responsible individuals who weren't able to build credit before. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEventually, the banks may make other financial products, like auto loans or mortgages, available to approved customers as well. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile banks and credit reporting firms \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90318224/now-wanted-by-equifax-and-other-credit-bureaus-your-alternative-data?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave tried\u003c/a\u003e setting up alternative risk models before, they haven't found an industry-wide solution. Last summer's protests around racial injustice provided an extra push, and last year, banking, fintech, and nonprofit leaders met with the Treasury Department to find ways to get more credit into historically disadvantaged communities.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e For decades, a credit score was the golden ticket to a credit card. While there's no shortage of finance startups \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/teen-banking-apps-secure-funding?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehawking\u003c/a\u003e credit-building apps to consumers as young as 13, a massive banking gap persists among adults: The creators of the FICO score estimate that 53 million US adults lack traditional credit scores. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUS commercial casinos raked in $11.1 billion last quarter, according to the American Gaming Association, matching their \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/sports-health-coronavirus-pandemic-business-bdf3597fde50ffafbb49965a3566757b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebest quarter ever\u003c/a\u003e. And 12 states set monthly gambling revenue records in March.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened? \u003c/strong\u003eIf the phrase of the year in 2020 was \"in these unprecedented times,\" 2021 has brought us \"pent-up demand.\" Flush with savings and itching for more excitement than a chessboard can provide, Americans have flocked to casinos to let loose.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd both traditional and new-ish sectors of the US gambling industry are seeing the benefits. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLas Vegas is back, if you trust all the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ktnv.com/positivelylv/las-vegas-is-tourism-is-exploding-with-more-and-more-people-flying-to-and-from-the-city?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elines out the door\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at McCarran International Airport. Southwest Airlines reported a significant rebound in traffic to Vegas after passenger demand plunged 97% during the pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSports gambling brought in $961 million last quarter, eclipsing the total revenue in 2019.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eStates home to more than three-quarters of commercial casinos had rules capping occupancy at 50% in Q1, so revenue could boom even more this summer as capacity restrictions ease.
